messages.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Please sort out all African countries involved in the "Belt and Road" initiative and their capitals as of June 2025, and query the surface area (in sq.km, using 2022 statistics, rounded to an integer), population density (people/sq.km of land area, using 2022 statistics, rounded to an integer), total population (in thousand, using 2023 statistics, rounded to an integer), and the proportion of merchandise trade in GDP (in percentage of GDP, using 2023 statistics, rounded to one decimal place) of these countries according to the statistics of the World Bank. 

Please output the sorted data in the format of one Markdown table. The column names in the table are: Country, Capital City, Surface Area (km²), Population Density (people/km² of land area), Total Population (thousands), Merchandise Trade (% of GDP).
Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```?

<think>
First, I need to identify which African countries are part of the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI). Then, I'll gather other specific data like capital cities, surface areas, population densities, populations, and merchandise trade proportions.
</think>

<search> African countries involved in the Belt and Road Initiative </search>

Search query: African countries involved in the Belt and Road Initiative
Result: [Doc 1](https://issafrica.org/iss-today/africa-has-much-to-gain-from-a-more-contained-bri):
Africa has much to gain from a more contained BRI In 2023, African countries received US$21.7 billion in BRI deals, including investments in ports, railways and renewable energy.

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belt_and_Road_Initiative):
Belt and Road Initiative - Wikipedia It aims to invest in over 150 countries and international organizations through six overland economic corridors and the 21st Century Maritime Silk Road. The BRI ...

[Doc 3](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/understanding-chinas-belt-and-road-infrastructure-projects-in-africa/):
Understanding China's Belt and Road infrastructure projects in Africa This paper examines the implementation of BRI infrastructure projects in Africa in light of available information and concludes that African experiences with ...

Based on these references, let’s consider countries that are actively involved or have projects under BRI. Notable African countries are Ethiopia, Kenya, Nigeria, Egypt, Morocco, etc.

<search> African countries involved in the Belt and Road Initiative and their capitals </search>

Search query: African countries involved in the Belt and Road Initiative and their capitals
Result: [Doc 1](https://greenfdc.org/countries-of-the-belt-and-road-initiative-bri/):
Countries of the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) The countries (excluding Palestine) of the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) are spread across all continents: Africa – 53 countries; Central Asia – 6 countries ...

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belt_and_Road_Initiative):
Belt and Road Initiative - Wikipedia It aims to invest in over 150 countries and international organizations through six overland economic corridors and the 21st Century Maritime Silk Road. The BRI ...

[Doc 3](https://www.armyupress.army.mil/Journals/Military-Review/English-Edition-Archives/May-June-2023/Chinas-Belt/):
China's Belt and Road Initiative in East Africa - Army University Press For the African nations participating in the BRI, benefits can also be in the eye of the beholder. Tanzania recently used its BRI participation to become one of ...

Based on these sources, here are some selected African countries:

- Ethiopia (Capital: Addis Ababa)
- Kenya (Capital: Nairobi)
- Nigeria (Capital: Abuja)
- Egypt (Capital: Cairo)
- Morocco (Capital: Rabat)
